intro: Orthocarpus pilosus, commonly known as the hairy orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate environments and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
